page.title: 17Canoeing on the Severn
page.content: The River Severn at Jackfield and Coalport is used by many canoeists.I belong to Shrewsbury canoe club.The river here is dark brown and quite murky.Its good for canoeing on because there are big rapids formed by rocks with water flowing very fast over them.At Jackfield the Severn is flowing at its fastest rate from the mountains to the sea. We put gates up for slalom courses.These are two wooden poles dangling from wire stretched between the banks about five feet above the water.We wear life-jackets because the river is very dangerous with its strong currents,stopper waves and pot holes.
